title.narrative: Internews: Livskraftiga media och CSOs I Moldavien
Internews: Viable Media Outlets and CSOs in Moldova

description.narrative: The contribution was implemented from October 1, 2019 to February 28, 2020, based around two objectives: Objective 1: Support independent media and production and dissemination of alternative content through grants and needs-based technical assistance. Objective 2: Nurture organisational capacity of local media non-profits for transition to direct major donor funding. In May 2020 it was agreed to have a no cost extension for having the final reports, including audit one. No changes/amendments were applied to objectives and activities during implementation period. The assistance provided within this project promoted media practices and content that nurture a more informed citizenry that understands the value of fact-based, credible journalism. As in most parts of the world, in Moldova propaganda and misinformation campaigns using traditional (press, radio, TV, film) and more recent (Internet, social media) platforms, aided by the affordability of mobile internet, have become a tool to push manipulative campaigns to far corners of the country, reaching communities that do not have a wide variety of media sources at their disposal to inform themselves.

Detta stöd för mediesektorn genom Internews förbereds som ett förenklat bidrag. Insatsen syftar till att stödja vissa medier och civilsamhällets organisationer i arbetet med att utveckla intern kapacitet och strategier. Projektet föruäntas fylla en viktig funktion i att stärka den oberoende mediesektorn och civilsamhället.
Insatsens totala budget uppgår till 4 090 757 SEK.

This support for media sector through Internews is prepared as a simplified contribution. It aims at supporting some media outlets and civil society organizations to develop its internal capacities and strategies. The project is expected to play an important role in strengthening the independent media sector and civil society.
The interventions' total budget is 4 090 757 SEK.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: 1. CSOs' better understanding of requirements of sound financial management Most of the beneficiaries considered only fundraising capacities, especially in relation to donor funds and did not follow a concrete procedure in financial planning and reporting. Three out of five CSOs did not have an annual consolidated budget and for the two that did have it, these budgets needed significant improvement. Experts team worked on this together with organizations. 2. Need for institutional support Internews provided a coherent programme of institutional support to consistently promote organisational development. A centralised approach led to the omission of some stages in the organisational development, which was negatively perceived by the beneficiaries and a more tailored approach was prefered. With this intervention, Internews was able to ensure that for each beneficiary, there was a single coordinator who would participate in all stages of organisational capacity development and organise the activity of different experts. 3. Discovering opportunities for mutual aid among the project beneficiaries There is an important potential for mutual aid among the project beneficiaries. Internews considered bringing them together to share their experiences and look into ways of supporting each other.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
